trans-unit.source: Index operations (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Index operations (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: You can create and manage indexes in Azure Search service via simple HTTP requests (POST, GET, PUT, DELETE) against a given index resource.
trans-unit.target: You can create and manage indexes in Azure Search service via simple HTTP requests (POST, GET, PUT, DELETE) against a given index resource.

trans-unit.source: To create an index, you first POST a JSON document that that describes the index schema.
trans-unit.target: To create an index, you first POST a JSON document that that describes the index schema.

trans-unit.source: The schema defines the fields of the index, their data types, and how they can be used (for example, in full-text searches, filters, sorting, faceting, or suggestions).
trans-unit.target: The schema defines the fields of the index, their data types, and how they can be used (for example, in full-text searches, filters, sorting, faceting, or suggestions).

trans-unit.source: It also defines scoring profiles and other attributes to configure the behavior of the index.
trans-unit.target: It also defines scoring profiles and other attributes to configure the behavior of the index.

trans-unit.source: The following example provides an illustration of a schema used for searching on hotel information with the Description field defined in two languages.
trans-unit.target: The following example provides an illustration of a schema used for searching on hotel information with the Description field defined in two languages.

trans-unit.source: Notice how attributes control how the field is used.
trans-unit.target: Notice how attributes control how the field is used.

trans-unit.source: For example the <codeInline>hotelId</codeInline> is used as the document key (<codeInline>"key":true</codeInline>) and is excluded from full-text searches (<codeInline>"searchable":false</codeInline>).
trans-unit.target: For example the <codeInline>hotelId</codeInline> is used as the document key (<codeInline>"key":true</codeInline>) and is excluded from full-text searches (<codeInline>"searchable":false</codeInline>).

trans-unit.source: After the index is created, you'll upload documents that populate the index.
trans-unit.target: After the index is created, you'll upload documents that populate the index.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="75503cda-fbc5-4e70-ac14-35fdedd0c001" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add documents (Azure Search API)</link> for this next step.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="75503cda-fbc5-4e70-ac14-35fdedd0c001" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add documents (Azure Search API)</link> for this next step.

trans-unit.source: For a video introduction to indexing, see the <externalLink><linkText>Channel 9 Cloud Cover episode 152 on Azure Search</linkText><linkUri>http://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/Cloud+Cover/Cloud-Cover-152-Azure-Search-with-Liam-Cavanagh</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For a video introduction to indexing, see the <externalLink><linkText>Channel 9 Cloud Cover episode 152 on Azure Search</linkText><linkUri>http://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/Cloud+Cover/Cloud-Cover-152-Azure-Search-with-Liam-Cavanagh</linkUri></externalLink>.
